org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class DateFormatter

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.DateFormatter

public class DateFormatter
extends Object

The class DateFormatter is a utility class that provides methods to format dates. This class currently provides methods to format dates in the simple date format "MM/dd/yyyy" or for simple date time the format is "MM/dd/yyyy"

Written:

Copyright (C) 2001, The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR).

All rights reserved.

 $Revision: 5209 $
 $Date: 2004-06-08 13:10:10 -0400 (Tue, 08 Jun 2004) $
 $Author: sreenath $

Author:
Anup Mahurkar

Field Summary
private static SimpleDateFormat dateFormatter
          The variable dateFormatter holds the class instance of a simple data formatter which is used to format dates in the following format: "MM/dd/yyyy"
private static SimpleDateFormat dateTimeFormatter
          The variable dateTimeFormatter holds the class instance of a simple data formatter which is used to format dates in the following format: "MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm"
private static SimpleDateFormat formatter
          The variable formatter holds an instance of SimpleDateFormatter, which is used to parse a date in 'dd-MMM-yyy' format.
private static SimpleDateFormat fullFormatter
          The variable fullFormatter holds holds an instance of SimpleDateFormatter, which is used to format a date in 'MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss:SSS' format.

public static String formatSimpleDate()
The formatSimpleDate method returns today's date in the format MM/dd/yyyy.

Returns:
a String value with todays date

getTodayString

public static String getTodayString()
The getTodayString method returns today's date in the format MM/dd/yyyy.

Returns:
a String value with todays date

formatSimpleDate

public static String formatSimpleDate(Date date)
The formatSimpleDate method formats the specified date int the MM/dd/yyyy format

Parameters:
date - a Date value that is to be formatted
Returns:
a String representing the formatted date

getNowString

public static String getNowString(boolean withMilliSeconds)
The getNowString method returns the current date & time in the format "MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss:SSS".

Parameters:
withMilliSeconds - a boolean value to indicate if millis are included in the output
Returns:
a String value with the date and time now

formatSimpleDateTime

public static String formatSimpleDateTime(Date date)
The formatSimpleDateTime method formats the specified date and time in the "MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm" format

Parameters:
date - a Date value that is to be formatted
Returns:
a String representing the formatted date and time

getTime

public static Date getTime()
The getTime method returns the current date and time with the minutes and seconds set to 0. This should be the preferred way to get the current date and time to create entries in the database as the database ignores minutes and seconds

Returns:
a Date value for the current data and time with minutes and seconds set to 0
